channel.title: Pastebin lolupdated
channel.description:
so today i worked on a java app to sit in da system tray and when you click it, it pastebins your clipboard, then it gets the url of the paste and either: copies to clipboard, or opens browser to the paste it will only work with java 6. to use your own icon for tray: [code]java Pastebin -Dtray.icon="url"[/code] dont feel like sauces until i make an interface for other bins, then it can be applied to other pastebin sites <3 it [i]should[/i] work on both linux and windows.
edit: so i've made source & target interfaces, so you can change where the paste comes from and where it goes, adding stuff such as making it upload images to imageshack, etc. im sure theres still some bugs.. so pls find dems lel also i only included 1 source & target, cbf making more examples. and im not including the main file's source right now, because its too dirty

item.title: Pastebin lolupdated
item.dc:creator: @ada ada
item.description:
@ada wrote:

[quote=“lawl, post:5, topic:58838”][quote author=Javacisnotrecognized link=topic=84015.msg909368#msg909368 date=1171685730]

AWT is about 20% faster, and loading the swing package takes about ~ .9MB

I don’t like AWT! Swing is way better.

AWT is your only chance at coming near decent speed for Java unless you wrote your own native library for it, in which case there’s no point in using Java in the first place.
[/quote]
incorrect, swing has its advantages, such as pluggable laf, expanded library, and swing isnt really slow… if you wanted speed you wouldnt be coding java.[/quote]

When you think about it, comparing AWT & Swing is like comparing apples & oranges. AWT has things that Swing doesn’t and vice versa.

Read full topic

item.title: Pastebin lolupdated
item.dc:creator: @Javacisnotrecognized _^_
item.description:
@Javacisnotrecognized wrote:

[quote=“lawl, post:5, topic:58838”][quote author=Javacisnotrecognized link=topic=84015.msg909368#msg909368 date=1171685730]

AWT is about 20% faster, and loading the swing package takes about ~ .9MB

I don’t like AWT! Swing is way better.

AWT is your only chance at coming near decent speed for Java unless you wrote your own native library for it, in which case there’s no point in using Java in the first place.
[/quote]
incorrect, swing has its advantages, such as pluggable laf, expanded library, and swing isnt really slow… if you wanted speed you wouldnt be coding java.[/quote]

I know, that’s what my JNI topic was about.

Also, about that, I figured out my compiler was on the wrong setting :rolleyes:

Read full topic

item.title: Pastebin lolupdated
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

so today i worked on a java app to sit in da system tray and when you click it, it pastebins your clipboard, then it gets the url of the paste and either: copies to clipboard, or opens browser to the paste
it will only work with java 6.
to use your own icon for tray:

java Pastebin -Dtray.icon="url"

dont feel like sauces until i make an interface for other bins, then it can be applied to other pastebin sites <3
it should work on both linux and windows.

edit:
so i’ve made source & target interfaces, so you can change where the paste comes from and where it goes, adding stuff such as making it upload images to imageshack, etc.
im sure theres still some bugs… so pls find dems lel
also i only included 1 source & target, cbf making more examples.
and im not including the main file’s source right now, because its too dirty
